techmeme.title: Microsoft reaches a settlement with French cloud service OVHcloud in which OVHcloud will drop its March 2022 antitrust complaint to EU regulators (Mathieu Pollet/Politico)
An ex-Reality Labs manager says Meta asked the unit to cut spending by ~20% from 2024 to 2026; Meta plans two Quest 4 versions in 2026 and a Quest Pro 2 in 2027 (The Information)
Intel veteran Lisa Spelman plans to become the CEO of Cornelis, a networking startup spun off from Intel in 2020, on August 15; Spelman joined Intel in 2000 (Jane Lanhee Lee/Bloomberg)
Block's Cash App plans to close its UK operations on September 15, after launching in 2018, as the company "deprioritizes global expansion" to focus on the US (Bloomberg)
Nvidia and Mistral release Mistral NeMo, a 12B-parameter language model with a 128K-token context window, available under the Apache 2.0 open-source license (Michael Nuñez/VentureBeat)
